feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 10:02AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA EXPECTED OVER KODIAK ISLAND THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT... Strong northwesterly winds up to 40 mph have developed across Shelikof Strait. These winds are resuspending ash from the 1912 Katmai-Novarupta eruption. The villages of Karluk and Larsen Bay are most likely to be impacted. Ash is currently north of Akhiok,

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:53AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snowfall Expected for the Eastern Interior and Alaska Range through Tuesday... A mix of rain and snow then changing to all snow for the Eastern Interior this morning. Not much accumulation expected for Fairbanks, but areas above 1000 feet could get up to 2 or 3 inches. Areas in the Alaska Range will likely get significant snow
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp; Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Fortymile Country; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Tanana Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and Blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 1:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and blowing snow in the Brooks Range into Monday... An arctic front moving through the Brooks Range will bring snow and blowing snow. 2 to 4 inches of snow is expected through Monday, along with northerly winds 15 to 30 mph which will reduce visibility. Use caution if traveling in the area.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 2:46PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Otero, southern Crowley and eastern Pueblo Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 246 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fowler, or 26 miles west of La Junta, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 9:29AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Prior rainfall and weather conditions will keep the Saint Johns River at Astor in Moderate Flood Stage. River levels are forecast to remain at to just above Moderate Flood Stage of 3.0 feet at Astor through the week.

At 228 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Walnut Canyon have moved north out of the canyon. However, flash flooding in the canyon is expected to continue for the next hour or two.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 1:50PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall that occurred overnight is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New Mexico, including the following county, Chaves. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:56PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Oldham and southeastern Hartley Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 356 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles west of Channing, or 26 miles north of Vega, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:51PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sherman, southeastern Dallam and northeastern Hartley Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 351 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Hartley, or 12 miles south of Dalhart, moving northeast at 25 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:50PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN REEVES COUNTY THROUGH 415 PM CDT... At 350 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northeast of Saragosa, or 19 miles south of Pecos, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail.

entry.summary: ...Red Flag Warning for portions of Southeast Texas, Central and Southern Louisiana this afternoon and early evening... Dewpoints will will continue to range from the lower 50s to the lower 60s this afternoon, yielding RH values in the 25-30% range. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 2:52PM MDT by NWS

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 02 at 2:29PM MDT until October 03 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected, mainly above 8,000 feet. Snow accumulation will vary greatly with elevation.
